title: [doc.rust-lang.org] std::path::Path examples give an error
body:
Hi there,

On std::path::Path documentation, [this example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/path/struct.Path.html?search=#examples-23) and [this one](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/path/struct.Path.html?search=#examples-24) give an error while assertions check.

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::path::Path;
assert_eq!(Path::new("./is_a_directory/").is_file(), false);
assert_eq!(Path::new("a_file.txt").is_file(), true);
```

and

```rust
use std::path::Path;
assert_eq!(Path::new("./is_a_directory/").is_dir(), true);
assert_eq!(Path::new("a_file.txt").is_dir(), false);
```

I expected to see this happen: assertions check is ok

Instead, this happened: assertions check isn't ok

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`: `rustc 1.13.0 (2c6933acc 2016-11-07)`

Backtrace for [`is_file()`](https://is.gd/sObJTX):

```compilation_error
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` (left: `false`, right: `true`)', <anon>:4
stack backtrace:
   1:     0x55da842f937f - std::sys::backtrace::tracing::imp::write::h6f1d53a70916b90d
   2:     0x55da842fbffd - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::h137e876f7d3b5850
   3:     0x55da842fb55a - std::panicking::default_hook::h0ac3811ec7cee78c
   4:     0x55da842fbaa8 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hc303199e04562edf
   5:     0x55da842fb942 - std::panicking::begin_panic::h6ed03353807cf54d
   6:     0x55da842fb880 - std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt::hc321cece241bb2f5
   7:     0x55da842f4cf4 - rust_out::main::hb497928495d48c40
                        at /tmp/<anon>:4
   8:     0x55da84303ac6 - __rust_maybe_catch_panic
   9:     0x55da842fadd1 - std::rt::lang_start::h538f8960e7644c80
  10:     0x55da842f4d33 - main
  11:     0x7f78bd38982f - __libc_start_main
  12:     0x55da842f46c8 - _start
  13:                0x0 - <unknown>
Program ended.
```

Backtrace for [`is_dir()`](https://is.gd/TUJz2T):

```compilation_error
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` (left: `false`, right: `true`)', <anon>:3
stack backtrace:
   1:     0x557923e3b37f - std::sys::backtrace::tracing::imp::write::h6f1d53a70916b90d
   2:     0x557923e3dffd - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::h137e876f7d3b5850
   3:     0x557923e3d55a - std::panicking::default_hook::h0ac3811ec7cee78c
   4:     0x557923e3daa8 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hc303199e04562edf
   5:     0x557923e3d942 - std::panicking::begin_panic::h6ed03353807cf54d
   6:     0x557923e3d880 - std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt::hc321cece241bb2f5
   7:     0x557923e36b4d - rust_out::main::hb497928495d48c40
                        at /tmp/<anon>:3
   8:     0x557923e45ac6 - __rust_maybe_catch_panic
   9:     0x557923e3cdd1 - std::rt::lang_start::h538f8960e7644c80
  10:     0x557923e36d33 - main
  11:     0x7fc2c049582f - __libc_start_main
  12:     0x557923e366c8 - _start
  13:                0x0 - <unknown>
Program ended.
```

I think these are the same, but we never know.

Thanks to your reading.
